title: Olympic Host Cities
description: Can you match the Olympic Games to the cities that hosted them?

questions.question: Which city hosted the 1992 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Barcelona, Spain hosted the 1992 Summer Olympics. The Games were notable for being the first since 1972 without any boycotts.

questions.question: Which Australian city hosted the 2000 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Sydney hosted the 2000 Summer Olympics. These Games are often considered among the best organized Olympics, with Cathy Freeman's 400m gold being a highlight.

questions.question: Which city hosted both the 1932 and 1984 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Los Angeles hosted the Summer Olympics in both 1932 and 1984, and will host again in 2028, making it one of only a few cities to host three times.

questions.question: Where were the 1964 Summer Olympics held, marking the first time Asia hosted the Games?
questions.explanation: Tokyo hosted the 1964 Summer Olympics, making Japan the first Asian country to host the Games. The Tokyo Olympics showcased Japan's post-war recovery and technological advancement.

questions.question: Which Scandinavian city hosted the 1952 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Helsinki, Finland hosted the 1952 Summer Olympics. These Games were notable for the debut of the Soviet Union and the outstanding performance of Emil Zatopek.

questions.question: Which city hosted the first Winter Olympics held in Asia in 1972?
questions.explanation: Sapporo, Japan hosted the 1972 Winter Olympics, making it the first Asian city to host the Winter Games. Thirty-five nations participated in 35 events.

questions.question: Which South American city was the first to host the Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Rio de Janeiro hosted the 2016 Summer Olympics, becoming the first South American city to host the Games. The opening ceremony was held at the famous Maracana stadium.

questions.question: Which Canadian city hosted the 1988 Winter Olympics?
questions.explanation: Calgary hosted the 1988 Winter Olympics. These Games are remembered for the debut of the Jamaican bobsled team, which later inspired the movie 'Cool Runnings.'

questions.question: Which city hosted the 1936 Summer Olympics, used as propaganda by Nazi Germany?
questions.explanation: Berlin hosted the 1936 Summer Olympics, which Adolf Hitler used as a propaganda tool. Jesse Owens' four gold medals undermined Nazi ideology about racial supremacy.

questions.question: Which city will host the 2028 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Los Angeles will host the 2028 Summer Olympics, making it the third time the city has hosted the Games (after 1932 and 1984).

questions.question: Which city hosted the 1976 Summer Olympics that were boycotted by many African nations?
questions.explanation: Montreal hosted the 1976 Summer Olympics. Twenty-two African nations boycotted the Games in protest of New Zealand's rugby tour of apartheid-era South Africa.

questions.question: Where were the 2018 Winter Olympics held?
questions.explanation: Pyeongchang, South Korea hosted the 2018 Winter Olympics. The Games were notable for the participation of a unified Korean women's ice hockey team.

questions.question: Which city hosted the 1896 first modern Olympics and the 2004 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Athens hosted both the first modern Olympics in 1896 and the 2004 Summer Olympics, returning the Games to their spiritual home after 108 years.

questions.question: Which city hosted the 1968 Summer Olympics, known for the Black Power salute?
questions.explanation: Mexico City hosted the 1968 Summer Olympics. The Games are remembered for Tommie Smith and John Carlos raising black-gloved fists on the medal podium in a civil rights protest.

questions.question: Which city will host the 2032 Summer Olympics?
questions.explanation: Brisbane, Australia will host the 2032 Summer Olympics. It will be the third time Australia hosts the Games, after Melbourne (1956) and Sydney (2000).
